title: Rise in factory output, Budget Session to start soon, & more

news.title: Quarterly Results: Wipro
news.description:
Net profit rose 2.8% to Rs 3,053 cr.
Revenue stood at Rs 23,299 cr - a rise of 14.3%
Attrition rate is now at 21.2%.

news.title: More...
news.description:
+India's factory output (IIP) grew 7.1% year-on-year in Nov. It had contracted by 4% in Oct.
+Parliament's Budget Session will begin from Jan 31.
+UK GDP rose by 0.1% in Nov vs 0.5% in Oct.
+Inflation in US stood at 6.5% - lowest in an year.
+Non-Residential Indians (NRIs) from 10 countries including USA and UAE will now be able to make UPI payments: NPCI.
+Wakefit raised $40 million in its Series D round.

news.title: Stocks in the news
news.description:
L&T: signed a pact with Norway-based H2Carrier (H2C) to develop floating green ammonia projects.
Jet Airways: NCLT has allowed the Jalan-Kalrock group 6 more months to make payment and take effective control of Jet Airways.
Tata Group: will set up 25,000 electric vehicle charging points across India.
BCL Industries: approved raising Rs 201 cr via issue of warrants.

news.title: Word of the Day
news.description:
NPCINational Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is a not-for-profit Indian company.
It was founded by the RBI and Indian Banks’ Association in 2008 with the goal of creating a robust payment & settlement infra.
NPCI launched UPI, IMPS, and RuPay in India.

news.title: 6 Day Course
news.description:
Theme: tools to pick stocks
Day 5: Friday
Psychological tools.
Many times, we lose sight of the larger picture when we’re too engrossed in one kind of activity.
Investors can make use of various mental models to look for and choose good stocks.
Commonly used mental models are: first principles thinking, circle of competence, inversion, etc. Do search them online and read more about them.
While picking stocks, it is easy for an investor to make errors because of psychological biases.
Similarly, investors must make active efforts to combat their own biases.
Common psychological biases affecting investors are hindsight bias, confirmation bias, recency bias, etc.
There are many tools investors can use. The ones discussed in this course so far are just a few examples.

news.title: Featured Question
news.description:
"I am well aware that money invested in the ELSS mutual funds have lock-in periods, let's say 3 years, then the principal amount invested is redeemable only after three years. But what about the profits/losses? Are they returned yearly?"
 
Don’t think of mutual funds like FD. Forget the concept of principal amount and interest.
Once you invest, that investment is locked for 3 years.
If the value of your investment rises, it is still counted as the same investment. So the amount and its profits/losses are locked for 3 years.
After 3 years, you can withdraw anytime or let it continue to remain invested.

introduction.content: Fact: Nifty has risen between 0% and 1% about 495 times in the last 5 years.
